intro: Hieracium kaeserianum, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in harsh, sunny conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Hieracium kaeserianum plays a role in alpine ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization.
